raw_response: Nougat & Peanut Cake, a Tunisian Jewish Djerban dessert, visually appears as a **layered, no-bake cake** with a distinctly textured base and creamy topping. The base is typically made of **crunchy cornflakes**, giving it a rough, irregular, and crunchy appearance in contrast to the smooth, thick peanut butter cream layered above. The cream layer looks dense, rich, and glossy due to the peanut butter and coconut oil content, making the cake appear indulgent and moist but solid in form, not soupy
